docs.abstract: Some Democratic rivals question whether Mr. Buttigieg has the experience to be president. Some key episodes in South Bend show how he struggled, learned and grew as a leader.
docs.snippet: Some Democratic rivals question whether Mr. Buttigieg has the experience to be president. Some key episodes in South Bend show how he struggled, learned and grew as a leader.
docs.lead_paragraph: SOUTH BEND, Ind. — The news was alarming: Children in some of South Bend’s poorest neighborhoods had a higher rate of lead poisoning than children in Flint, Mich.

headline.main: What Being a Mayor Taught Pete Buttigieg
headline.print_headline: Hard Lessons And Big Ideas Of Mayor Pete

docs.abstract: Voters in Nevada and South Carolina face an all-white top tier of 2020 candidates that was winnowed down by a largely white electorate.
docs.snippet: Voters in Nevada and South Carolina face an all-white top tier of 2020 candidates that was winnowed down by a largely white electorate.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Kristina Alvarez, a 36-year-old medical aide in Las Vegas, knows how badly the Democrats want her attention and ideally her vote. So does JA Moore, 34, a state representative in Charleston, S.C., whose endorsement was highly sought after.

headline.main: Black and Latino Voters Are Looking for ‘More Than Just Some Token Words’
headline.print_headline: Looking for White Candidates to Offer More Than ‘Some Token Words’

byline.original: By Jennifer Medina and Stephanie Saul

docs.abstract: The Democratic candidates ripped into one another — and especially Michael Bloomberg — as the Nevada caucuses approached.
docs.snippet: The Democratic candidates ripped into one another — and especially Michael Bloomberg — as the Nevada caucuses approached.
docs.lead_paragraph: We are still not done counting votes in Iowa, but on we go anyway: It’s time for more caucuses. Let’s hope they go more smoothly.

headline.main: Loathing in Las Vegas: This Week in the 2020 Race

byline.original: By Matt Stevens and Maggie Astor

docs.abstract: Nevada is more diverse than Iowa and in many ways more reflective of the Democratic Party. And it has a different take on how caucuses should work.
docs.snippet: Nevada is more diverse than Iowa and in many ways more reflective of the Democratic Party. And it has a different take on how caucuses should work.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the chaos in Iowa, Nevada Democrats want to show the country what a caucus should look like.

headline.main: Another Caucus Is Coming. But Nevada Will Look Completely Different.
headline.print_headline: Another Caucus Nears, But Nevada Has Little  In Common With Iowa

docs.abstract: Joe Biden has recounted a story — three times in two weeks — about being arrested on his way to see Nelson Mandela. He did not mention it in his memoir or speak prominently of it before.
docs.snippet: Joe Biden has recounted a story — three times in two weeks — about being arrested on his way to see Nelson Mandela. He did not mention it in his memoir or speak prominently of it before.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — In at least three campaign appearances over the past two weeks, Joseph R. Biden Jr. has told a similar story as he tries to revive his campaign in states with more diverse voters. On a trip to South Africa years ago, he has said, he was arrested as he sought to visit Nelson Mandela in prison.

headline.main: Biden Adds a Claim to His Biography: An Arrest in South Africa
headline.print_headline: Biden Adds a ’70s Arrest In Soweto to His Résumé

byline.original: By Katie Glueck and Thomas Kaplan

docs.abstract: Joe Biden and Pete Buttigieg, facing increasing pressure to slow the Vermont senator’s rise before Super Tuesday, criticized his record on gun control and his chances against President Trump.
docs.snippet: Joe Biden and Pete Buttigieg, facing increasing pressure to slow the Vermont senator’s rise before Super Tuesday, criticized his record on gun control and his chances against President Trump.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — The day after a Democratic presidential debate brought out the candidates’ outrage at Michael R. Bloomberg, the focus turned back toward Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, who leads polls of Nevada, California and the nation.

headline.main: Democrats Pile on Bernie Sanders as Urgency Grows
headline.print_headline: Debate Behind Them, Democrats Return to a Familiar Foil in Sanders

byline.original: By Reid J. Epstein and Katie Glueck

docs.abstract: Michael Bloomberg’s campaign advisers had anticipated tough debate questions on stop-and-frisk and nondisclosure agreements. The former mayor’s performance left his team rattled.
docs.snippet: Michael Bloomberg’s campaign advisers had anticipated tough debate questions on stop-and-frisk and nondisclosure agreements. The former mayor’s performance left his team rattled.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg had put in the hours, his people said — holding mock debate sessions with top aides and meeting at length to prepare in New York and Palm Springs, Calif.

headline.main: How Bloomberg Bungled a Debate That He Had Been Prepped For
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Was Primed. Why Did He Sputter?

byline.original: By Matt Flegenheimer, Alexander Burns and Jeremy W. Peters

docs.abstract: “They don’t work for a multitude of reasons,” the former Senate majority leader said, adding to the push for Democrats to switch to primaries in all states.
docs.snippet: “They don’t work for a multitude of reasons,” the former Senate majority leader said, adding to the push for Democrats to switch to primaries in all states.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Harry Reid, the former Senate majority leader who remains the functional head of the Nevada Democrats, said on Sunday that caucuses should no longer be used to nominate candidates for president of the United States.

headline.main: Harry Reid Says Nevada Should Have a Primary: ‘All Caucuses Should Be a Thing of the Past’
headline.print_headline: Reid Calls For Nevada  To Switch To Primary

docs.abstract: Seven Democrats will be debating in Charleston, S.C., four days before the South Carolina primary. Last week’s forum smashed a TV ratings record.
docs.snippet: Seven Democrats will be debating in Charleston, S.C., four days before the South Carolina primary. Last week’s forum smashed a TV ratings record.
docs.lead_paragraph: Steyer: The biggest misconception is that I’m defined by business success and money. My motto is, tell the truth and do what’s right.

headline.main: Highlights From the Democratic Debate in South Carolina

byline.original: By Shane Goldmacher and Reid J. Epstein

docs.abstract: The Minnesota senator is running for president as a pragmatist. But some Democrats and civil rights groups say she went too far in supporting judges chosen by the current administration.
docs.snippet: The Minnesota senator is running for president as a pragmatist. But some Democrats and civil rights groups say she went too far in supporting judges chosen by the current administration.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On the campaign trail, from the debate stage and in private fund-raisers, Senator Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota trumpets her years of experience as a lawmaker and her bipartisan appeal as a pragmatist as the central assets that would make her the toughest Democratic nominee to face off against President Trump.

headline.main: Amy Klobuchar’s Bipartisan Record Includes Voting for Many Trump Judicial Nominees
headline.print_headline: Klobuchar Takes Fire  Over Past Votes in Favor  Of Trump Judicial Picks

byline.original: By Lisa Lerer and Nick Corasaniti
